citation.article-title: Kibdelosporangium albatum sp. nov., producer of the antiviral antibiotics cycloviracins.

p.s: Description of Kibdelosporangium albatum sp. nov.
Kibdelosporangium albatum (al' ba. tum. L. adj. albatus, clothed in white, referring to the color of the aerial mycelium and the nonchromogenicity of the organism)
Aerobic actinomycete with substrate and aerial mycelia.
The substrate mycelium exhibits various degrees of fragmentation.
The aerial mycelium bears long straight chains of cylindrical spores with smooth surfaces, and sporangiumlike globular bodies 8 to 20 μm in diameter.
The globules are surrounded by a membranous envelope and contain irregularly coiled hyphae but no spores.
Motile spores are not formed by the strain.
The color of the aerial mycelium is white or yellow.
The substrate mycelium penetrates the agar and is yellow, orange- yellow, or light brown depending on the medium.
Acid is formed from various carbon compounds (Table 2).
Grows at temperatures between 17 and 45°C; the optimal temperature is 37°C.
Antagonistic properties: weakly active on Bacillus subtilis but inactive on Micrococcus luteus and fungal strains.
The type strain is strain R761-7 (= ATCC 55061).
